name: Cauliflower Pizza Crust
author: Alli Shircliff
summary: You will never guess this rich, grain-free pizza crust is made with cauliflower instead of flour. Serve with your favorite sauce and toppings.
ingredients: ½ cup shredded Italian cheese blend
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Place cauliflower pieces through the feeding tube of the food processor using the grating blade; pulse until all the cauliflower is shredded
Place a steamer insert into a saucepan and fill with water to just below the bottom of the steamer
Add cauliflower, cover, and steam until tender, about 15 minutes
Transfer cauliflower to a large bowl and refrigerate, stirring occasionally, until cooled, about 15 minutes
Preheat an oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C)
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicon mat
Stir Italian cheese blend, parsley, egg, garlic, salt, and pepper into cauliflower until evenly incorporated
Pour mixture onto the prepared baking sheet; press and shape into a pizza crust
Bake in the preheated oven until lightly browned, about 15 minutes
